posts.post_content: No serious offers so going to eBay

you didn't post a price on it. what is the askiing price?

kevin

I posted I was looking for offers but it seems the only response I get is "how much."

So I'm just going to pull these from here and put them on eBay with a much higher BIN them I probably would have sold them for here. If they don't sell they'll go to legendary in the fall.  

Thanks

[quote name="Blitzu" post=1139035]I posted I was looking for offers but it seems the only response I get is "how much."

So I'm just going to pull these from here and put them on eBay with a much higher BIN them I probably would have sold them for here. If they don't sell they'll go to legendary in the fall.  

Thanks[/QUOTE]

Had you put a price on it you probably would have sold it. Most people, me included, don't care for the make an offer sales. But to each their own and good luck with it.

[quote name="Leon" post=1139062]Had you put a price on it you probably would have sold it. Most people, me included, don't care for the make an offer sales. But to each their own and good luck with it.[/QUOTE]

Yes agreed, to each their own, but I have participated in severals purchases that way of highly sought after or rare items and have had no problems.  I wanted to give the community here an opportunity at some nice items that don't come around all that often but It appears these are better suited for an auction site.

Hopefully they find a nice home soon.

Really none of my business, but I'm wondering why you wouldn't post a price on here but you will put a BIN price on ebay?

Rick

[quote name="buymycards" post=1139085]Really none of my business, but I'm wondering why you wouldn't post a price on here but you will put a BIN price on ebay?

Rick[/QUOTE]

I was trying to avoid a BIN price by offering it here but that is the only way I'll sell something on eBay... eBay Auctions are the worst way to go. I figure it doesn't hurt at all to post it high there for free to see if anyone buys it. Because of all the fees I have to price it higher.

I'm willing to sell these at a respectable price but I'm not exactly sure what that is, but I surely know its not the prices one member quoted from canfield's site.  I'm not going to give these away.

[quote name="Leon" post=1139062]Had you put a price on it you probably would have sold it. Most people, me included, don't care for the make an offer sales. But to each their own and good luck with it.[/QUOTE]

exactly. 

let me summarize the no price tag scenario and why people/i don't like it:

``I want to sell it but im not going to put a price on it. you tell me what you want to give me for it and hope that i wont get offended when the offer is to low.``

Or

``my offer is over what you expected and then i overpayed.``

its a lose lose. your trying to capitalize to the Nth degree on your item which is a turn off to any buyer looking for fair price or a deal. just post a fair price on it that meets your comfort level and see what happens. if you don't get that fair price don't sell it. tuck it back away or let it sit there in the 'buy it now museum' with the rest of the over priced stuff.

kevin

I can't wait to see it listed in legendary with an opening bid of "I don't really know what the seller wants but if you'll submit a bid we'll ask him to consider it." Personally I wish we would insist on a price for listing on BST.
